chargeHist.descr: Identity Theft - Obtain Money or Credit

result.execSummary:
The defendant Zachery Thomas Hunter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Identity Theft - Obtain Money or Credit, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.203(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
07-19-2017/ Judge Dennis Cimpl                 
The court ordered that the JOC shall be amended to reflect a total of eight days of sentence credit

miscConds.notes:
-Restitution set at $1,991.31 payable to 
Boy Scout Troop 96.   Bail on deposit to be applied to restitution.  Remaining balance to be paid during term of probation.  If defendant is revoked, restitution to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds.  Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment

-Defendant to pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments to be collected during term probation.  If defendant is revoked, all applicable surcharges and assessments are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds. Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected during term of probation. If defendant is revoked, all related surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-Pay all supervision fees.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause

-Cooperate with agent
-Cooperate with any correctional programs recommended
-Follow all rules of probation and extended supervision
-Court allows for defendant to participate in Dosage Probation

-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances

timeConds.notes: -Defendant to perform 50 hours of community service

Bail Refund Packet
Letter for victim - showing the defendant is paid in full.
Restitution refund check packet

Defendant Zachery Thomas Hunter in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pursuant to plea negotiations, and on motion of the State, Court ordered the Repeater penalty enhancer dismissed.  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.   Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by State, Defense and Defendant.  

The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 3 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 1 1/2 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 1 1/2 YEARS.  Court STAYED sentence and placed the defendant on PROBATION for a period of 2 YEARS with the following conditions for probation and extended supervision:
Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program. civil rights have been restored.  

-Restitution set at $1,991.31 payable to Boy Scout Troop 96.   Bail on deposit to be applied to restitution.  Remaining balance to be paid during term of probation.  If defendant is revoked, restitution to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds.  Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant to pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments to be collected during term probation.  If defendant is revoked, all applicable surcharges and assessments are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds. Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected during term of probation. If defendant is revoked, all related surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-Cooperate with agent
-Cooperate with any correctional programs recommended
-Follow all rules of probation and extended supervision
-Pay all supervision fees 
-Obtain/maintain employment 
-Obtain GED or HSE
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances
-Defendant to perform 50 hours of community service
-Court allows for defendant to participate in Dosage Probation

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Defendant Zachery Thomas Hunter in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Defendant Zachery Thomas Hunter in custody.  Tom Potter for Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Case adjourned to Br. 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Zachery Thomas Hunter in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Defendant Zachery Thomas Hunter in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is reassigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22 due to the assignment of the Assistant District Attorney.  Arraignment scheduled for March 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.

No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
